intro: Myrsine medeciloae, commonly known as the Madagascar myrsine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant features simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds.
